abstract: Hague District Court in Netherlands orders Dutch government to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by at least 25 percent from 1990 levels in next five years as result of groundbreaking lawsuit brought by environmental group Urgenda; decision, citing work of scientific bodies and human rights law, is expected to spur more lawsuits by organizations focused on mitigating and preventing climate change against other governments.
lead_paragraph: The decision by the Dutch court could motivate environmental activists to pursue a similar legal strategy in other countries.

headline.main: Ruling Says Netherlands Must Reduce Greenhouse Gas Emissions
headline.print_headline: Ruling Says Netherlands Must Reduce Emissions

snippet: The decision by the Dutch court could motivate environmental activists to pursue a similar legal strategy in other countries.
